subject: Photography
title: Simplicity and Minimalism
description: Learn Simplicity and Minimalism in one minute.

hook.text: The most powerful photographs often contain the least. Remove everything that doesn't serve the story.

buildup.text: Clutter confuses the eye. A busy background, extra objects, competing colors ‚Äî they all dilute your message.

discovery.text: Simplifying means isolating your subject. Move closer, change angles, or use blur to eliminate distractions.

twist.text: Minimalism isn't emptiness. It's intentional inclusion. Every element that remains must earn its place in the frame.

climax.text: A lone tree on a snowy hill. One red umbrella on a gray street. Simplicity amplifies emotion.

punchline.text: What you leave out matters more than what you keep.

quiz.question: What does simplicity in composition achieve?
options: It isolates the subject and strengthens the message
It always requires a white background
